name: Paladin
description: Holy warriors who combine martial prowess with divine magic, sworn to uphold sacred oaths and vanquish evil from the world.

resource_systems.name: Mana
resource_systems.description: Divine energy that powers holy spells and abilities
resource_systems.regeneration: 1 per 6 seconds, +2 when smiting evil creatures
mechanics: Mana points are spent to cast divine spells and channel holy power
Some abilities require maintaining a divine connection, consuming mana over time
Prayer increases mana regeneration rate by 300% but requires remaining stationary

resource_systems.name: Divine Favor
resource_systems.description: Blessing from the divine that empowers righteous actions
resource_systems.regeneration: 1 per hour, additional points gained through upholding oaths and defeating evil
mechanics: Divine Favor can be spent to enhance weapon attacks with holy power
Can be used to empower healing spells or protective auras
Acts as a resource for powerful oath abilities
Violations of paladin code can result in temporary loss of Divine Favor

class_mechanics.name: Divine Smite
class_mechanics.description: Channel divine power through weapon strikes to smite enemies
effects: Can infuse weapon attacks with holy energy for additional damage
Smite damage is doubled against undead and fiends
Critical hits with Divine Smite cause enemies to be briefly stunned
Each successful smite generates additional threat against the target

class_mechanics.name: Lay on Hands
class_mechanics.description: Channel healing energy directly into wounded allies
effects: Heal allies by touch for significant amounts based on paladin level
Can be used to cure diseases and neutralize poisons
Healing pool refreshes after a long rest
Can distribute healing among multiple targets as needed

class_mechanics.name: Divine Aura
class_mechanics.description: Project an aura of divine energy that affects nearby allies and enemies
effects: Provides passive bonuses to nearby allies based on the active aura
Can switch between different auras as needed (protection, courage, etc.)
Aura range increases with paladin level
Presence causes unease in evil creatures and comfort to good ones

skill_trees.name: Oath of Devotion
key_abilities: Sacred Weapon: Imbue weapon with holy light that never misses
Divine Shield: Create a protective barrier around an ally
Turn the Unholy: Force undead and fiends to flee in terror

skill_trees.name: Oath of Justice
key_abilities: Divine Judgment: Mark an enemy for judgment, increasing damage taken
Righteous Strike: Guaranteed critical hit against evil creatures
Aura of Justice: Allies deal additional holy damage to marked targets

skill_trees.name: Oath of Sacrifice
key_abilities: Martyr's Blessing: Take damage intended for an ally
Sacrificial Healing: Convert own health into healing for allies
Final Stand: Become invulnerable for a short time while at low health

bonuses: Divine Smite damage increased by 15% against undead and demons
Resistance to corruption and evil magic increased by 20%

arch_classes.name: Oathkeeper
arch_classes.description: Paladins who have deepened their divine connection through unwavering devotion to their sacred oaths.
skill_requirements: At least 5 points in any paladin oath skill tree
Completion of the 'Trial of Faith' quest

lore: Paladins are holy warriors who have sworn sacred oaths to uphold justice, righteousness, and the light of the divine. Through unwavering faith and rigorous training, they combine martial prowess with divine magic, becoming beacons of hope in a world often threatened by darkness. Each paladin serves a higher power—be it a specific deity, an abstract concept like justice, or the very essence of light itself—and draws strength from this connection. Their divine magic manifests primarily through their weapons, healing touch, and protective auras, allowing them to smite evil, protect the innocent, and inspire allies. The path of a paladin is one of strict discipline and moral code, requiring adherence to principles like honesty, courage, compassion, honor, and duty. Those who stray from their oaths risk losing their divine connection, though redemption is always possible through atonement. Paladins are respected and sometimes feared for their unwavering conviction, serving as both warriors and spiritual leaders in communities across the realm.
